title: Persistent Systems share price falls 2.07%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Persistent Systems declined by 2.07%, with the stock trading at Rs 4,997 at 2:14 pm. Persistent Systems is scheduled to hold a board meeting on October 13-14, 2025, to consider the audited financial results for the quarter and half-year ending September 30, 2025. The trading window will remain closed from September 24, 2025, to October 16, 2025, and will reopen on October 17, 2025. Financial Performance: Persistent Systems' consolidated financial performance reveals consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,938.72 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 9,821.59 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,400.16 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 1,093.49 Crore in March 2024. The quarterly results also reflect positive trends. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,333.59 Crore, compared to Rs 3,242.11 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter stood at Rs 424.94 Crore, up from Rs 395.76 Crore in the previous quarter. Key financial data is presented below:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)4,187.895,710.758,350.599,821.5911,938.72Net Profit (Rs Crore)450.68690.39921.091,093.491,400.16EPS58.9790.34123.7372.4491.22BVPS365.81440.72518.82321.82405.46ROE (%)16.1220.4923.2322.0522.15Debt to Equity0.000.130.110.040.00Income Statement (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Sales (Rs Crore)2,7372,8973,0623,2423,333Other Income (Rs Crore)3046421854Total Income (Rs Crore)2,7672,9433,1043,2603,388Total Expenditure (Rs Crore)2,3532,4902,6062,7362,815EBIT (Rs Crore)414452498523572Interest (Rs Crore)1418161817Tax (Rs Crore)94109109109130Net Profit (Rs Crore)306325372395424The company’s revenue has shown consistent growth over the past few years. The annual revenue for March 2025 was Rs 11,938 Crore, which represents a substantial increase of approximately 21.56% compared to the revenue of Rs 9,821 Crore in March 2024. Similarly, the net profit for March 2025 stood at Rs 1,400 Crore, marking a significant increase of 28.05% from the Rs 1,093 Crore reported in March 2024. In the quarterly results, the net profit for June 2025 was Rs 424 Crore, a rise of 7.34% compared to Rs 395 Crore in March 2025. This growth is reflected in the EPS, which increased from Rs 25.64 in March 2025 to Rs 27.43 in June 2025. Corporate Actions: Persistent Systems has announced dividends in the past. A final dividend of Rs 15 per share (300%) was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of July 14, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 20 per share (400%) was announced on January 8, 2025, effective January 31, 2025. The company had also split its shares, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 5. The ex-split date was March 28, 2024, and the record date was April 1, 2024. title: Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency shares fall 2.11% in today's trading
content: Shares of Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency experienced a decline of 2.11%, with the stock price reaching Rs 147.10. This movement places the stock among losers and the stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Regarding the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,743.32 Crore, marking a notable increase compared to Rs 4,963.93 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,698.34 Crore, up from Rs 1,252.24 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS stood at Rs 6.32 as of March 2025, compared to Rs 5.16 in March 2024. The company’s consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,947.60 Crore, compared to Rs 1,510.27 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 246.88 Crore, compared to Rs 383.70 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.91, while it was Rs 1.43 for the quarter-ending June 2024. title: Bharat Forge shares fall 2.05%, stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Bharat Forge declined by 2.05% to Rs 1,182.50 in Friday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. This price movement reflects a notable change from the previous close. Financial Performance: Bharat Forge's financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated figures: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.75 Crore, compared to Rs 4,106.15 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 287.14 Crore, up from Rs 173.89 Crore in the previous year. The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,122.80 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 15,682.07 Crore reported in March 2024. The annual net profit increased to Rs 916.98 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 904.84 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios include a P/E ratio of 58.31 and a P/B ratio of 6.03 as of March 2025. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio was 0.68 for the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financials:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024 (Quarterly)Jun 2025 (Quarterly)RevenueRs 4,106.15 CroreRs 3,908.75 CroreNet ProfitRs 173.89 CroreRs 287.14 CroreEPSRs 4.36Rs 5.93Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2024 (Annual)Mar 2025 (Annual)RevenueRs 15,682.07 CroreRs 15,122.80 CroreNet ProfitRs 904.84 CroreRs 916.98 CroreEPSRs 20.43Rs 20.05BVPSRs 153.88Rs 193.53ROE13.26%10.17%Debt to Equity1.050.68Corporate Actions: Bharat Forge has announced several corporate actions, including trading window closures and dividend payouts. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 8, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (125%) was announced on February 12, 2025, and paid out on February 18, 2025. Other corporate actions include bonus issues, rights issues, and stock splits. A bonus ratio of 1:1 was declared on August 10, 2017, with a record date of September 30, 2017, and an ex-bonus date of September 28, 2017. The stock underwent a split on July 20, 2005, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Bharat Forge is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares fall 2.05%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam declined by 2.05% to Rs 339.45 on Friday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Rail Vikas Nigam has demonstrated fluctuating quarterly performance. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.77 Crore, compared to Rs 6,426.88 Crore in March 2025, Rs 4,567.38 Crore in December 2024, Rs 4,854.95 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 4,073.80 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 124.99 Crore, down from Rs 406.74 Crore in March 2025. The EPS stood at Rs 0.65. The company's consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,923.02 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 21,889.23 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,186.11 Crore, also lower than the Rs 1,574.47 Crore reported in March 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 6.15. title: L&T rallies over 3 percent after Telangana takes over Hyderabad Metro's debt, pays Rs 2,000 crore as one-time settlement
content: Shares of Larsen and Toubro are higher by more than 3.5 percent on September 26, as investors welcomed the clarity on financials after Telangana government agreed to take over Phase-I of Hyderabad Metro project for a payment of Rs 2,000 crore along with taking over the debt worth Rs 13,000 crore, a report by news agency PTI said. This is a nine-month high for the shares of L&T. "After detailed negotiations, with an objective to expedite the phase 2 approval by GoI, it was agreed in principle that the State government would take over Phase-I Metro Rail project by taking over the debt of the project, which now stands at about Rs 13,000 cr. Further, the state government will pay about Rs 2,000 cr to L&T towards their equity investment in LTMRHL as a one-time settlement," PTI News reported citing people familiar with the development. The news report added that L&T had last month expressed interest in offloading its stake in the Metro Rail project citing operational and accumulated losses, following which the decision was taking in a meeting between Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy and senior officials with L&T group CMD S N Subrahmanyan. The Group had been exploring divestment options of non-core assets and various alternatives to de-risk exposure in L&T Metro Rail (Hyderabad). A consortium of 10 lenders, including State Bank of India has sanctioned the debt for the project. L&T Metro - Financials L&T Hyderabad Metro Rail's revenue from operations for FY25 was Rs 1,108.54 crore versus Rs 1,399.31 crore a year ago, a fall of 21 percent, with loss increasing by 13 percent on year, owing to delays and cost overrun. The SPV posted a loss of Rs 208 crore in Q1FY26 as compared to a loss of Rs 214 crore in Q1 FY25. . The EBITDA for Hyderabad metro was Rs 101 crore during Q1FY25 and stands at Rs 112 crore in Q1FY26. "...at the current level of roughly Rs 12,500-odd crore of debt, the Hyderabad metro interest averages around Rs 240-250 crore," the company had said in the June quarter earnings call, which has resulted in a loss worth Rs 208 crore on L&T's books in Q1FY26. JM Financial in a note said it expects L&T to surpass its 18 percent target of RoE in FY26 once Hyderabad Metro losses end, and interest income adds up. About Hyderabad Metro The Hyderabad metro rail system comprises of three elevated corridors from Miyapur to LB Nagar, Jubilee Bus Station to Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station and Nagole to Raidurg, covering a total network of 69.2 km. The metro network was commissioned in phases, with the final stretch being commissioned in February 2020. In May 2025, the fare per passenger has been revised upwards on a net basis by 20 percent over existing fares. Other Recent Triggers L&T has recently announced a strategic partnership with BEL for the 5th-gen fighter (AMCA) programme, under which it will be submitting an Expression of Interest (EoI) for the project soon. The company is also working on semiconductor products that are expected to be released next year, with the CEO of unit, Sandeep Kumar, stating that the semiconductor arm will consider an IPO after crossing the $500 million mark in revenue, according to ICICI Direct.

title: Buy Godrej Consumer Products; target of Rs 1430: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Godrej Consumer Products With the GST cut boosting soaps and men’s grooming range (~35% of its domestic range) and innovations (Godrej Fab, Godrej Ninja) scaling up well, Godrej Consumer Products is an attractive play on consumption recovery. We expect its international business to deliver high single-digit growth (Indonesia recovery, strong Africa, FTAs aiding Europe/UK), while its India volume growth should improve with the GST cut. Margin tailwinds from price increases (in soaps), premiumisation and cost efficiency measures should drive profit growth ahead of revenue, making it a compelling medium-term compounder. For the year we factor in persistent higher inflation in palm oil, GST rate cuts and a slightly weaker Indonesian performance, and lower our FY26e/FY27e EPS 8%/4% and introduce FY28e. Outlook We retain a Buy, with an unchanged 12-mth TP of Rs1,430, 50x Sep’27e EPS (earlier, 52x FY27e EPS). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. title: Eternal shares fall 2.03% in Friday's trade
content: Eternal shares experienced a decline of 2.03% to Rs 325.50 in Friday's trading session. The stock's movement reflected a decrease from its previous close. Eternal is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Highlights Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Eternal's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,167 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 4,206 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 25 Crore, significantly lower than the Rs 253 Crore reported in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also decreased to Rs 0.03 in June 2025, down from Rs 0.29 in June 2024. The company's revenue has shown consistent growth over the quarters, with Rs 4,799 Crore in September 2024, Rs 5,405 Crore in December 2024, and Rs 5,833 Crore in March 2025. Here's a summary of the key financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,206.00 CroreRs 4,799.00 CroreRs 5,405.00 CroreRs 5,833.00 CroreRs 7,167.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 253.00 CroreRs 176.00 CroreRs 59.00 CroreRs 39.00 CroreRs 25.00 CroreEPS0.290.200.070.040.03Consolidated Yearly Performance: The annual revenue for Eternal saw a substantial increase, reaching Rs 20,243 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 12,114 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also improved to Rs 527 Crore, a significant turnaround from a loss of Rs 970.70 Crore in March 2023. The EPS increased to Rs 0.60 in March 2025, up from Rs 0.41 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Eternal show a P/E ratio of 336.17 and a P/B ratio of 6.03 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. The company’s sales have steadily increased year-over-year, with other income also contributing significantly to the total income. The total expenditure has also increased, but the company has managed to turn losses into profits over the past two years. Here’s a summary of the key annual financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 1,993.79 CroreRs 4,192.40 CroreRs 7,079.40 CroreRs 12,114.00 CroreRs 20,243.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 816.43 Crore-Rs 1,222.80 Crore-Rs 970.70 CroreRs 351.00 CroreRs 527.00 CroreEPS-1.51-1.67-1.200.410.60BVPS246,389.5821.5923.2623.5133.43ROE-10.63-7.32-4.991.711.73Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Corporate Actions Eternal Limited has announced the closure of the trading window as per SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015. This was announced on September 20, 2025. Additionally, the company informed the exchange about three orders received from the Joint Commissioner, Appeals-4, Bengaluru on August 25, 2025. The company also announced the incorporation of Blinkit Foods Limited as a wholly-owned subsidiary on August 21, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 325.50, Eternal has seen a decline of 2.03% in Friday's trading session.

title: Havells India shares fall 2.01%; stock among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Havells India declined by 2.01% to Rs 1,508.70 in Friday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index. On the financial front, Havells India has demonstrated steady growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 21,778.06 Crore, compared to Rs 18,590.01 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,470.24 Crore, up from Rs 1,270.76 Crore in March 2024. The company’s quarterly performance also reflects this positive trend. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Havells India reported a revenue of Rs 5,455.35 Crore and a net profit of Rs 347.53 Crore. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 5,806.21 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 407.51 Crore. Here's a summary of Havells India's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 202110,457.301,044.3116.68Mar 202213,938.481,196.4719.11Mar 202316,910.731,071.7317.11Mar 202418,590.011,270.7620.28Mar 202521,778.061,470.2423.49The company's balance sheet indicates a strong financial position. As of March 2025, Havells India had total assets of Rs 13,809 Crore, compared to Rs 12,432 Crore in the previous year. The debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00, indicating minimal debt. Key financial ratios for Havells India as of March 2025 include: Basic EPS (Rs.) 23.49, Book Value [Excl. Reval Reserve]/Share (Rs.) 132.78, and Dividend/Share (Rs.) 10.00. The company has announced several dividends in recent years. Most recently, a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share was announced on April 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 23, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share was announced on January 10, 2025, effective January 22, 2025. Havells India has also undertaken corporate actions such as bonus issues and stock splits in the past. The company announced a stock split on June 30, 2014, where the old face value of Rs 5 was split into a new face value of Rs 1, with an ex-split date of August 26, 2014, and a record date of August 27, 2014. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. According to a Moneycontrol analysis from September 22, 2025, investor sentiment is bullish. Shares of Havells India declined by 2.01% to Rs 1,508.70 in Friday's session.
